criteria: Identification of Air Pollution Sources and Health Impacts
Identification of Water Pollution Sources and Health Impacts
Explanation of the Interconnectedness of Air and Water Pollution and Health
descriptions: Does not identify any sources of air pollution or their impact on health.
Identifies only one source of air pollution and/or a vague impact on health.
Identifies some common sources of air pollution (e.g., vehicle emissions, industrial processes) and mentions a general health impact (e.g., respiratory issues).
Identifies several sources of air pollution and provides a basic description of their specific health impacts (e.g., asthma, lung irritation).
Identifies various sources of air pollution (both indoor and outdoor) and thoroughly explains the specific health impacts associated with each (e.g., cardiovascular problems, cancer).

Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of diverse sources of air pollution, their detailed health impacts, and provides examples of vulnerable populations. Also, provides solutions to lower air pollution impact.
Does not identify any sources of water pollution or their impact on health.
Identifies only one source of water pollution and/or a vague impact on health.
Identifies some common sources of water pollution (e.g., sewage, agricultural runoff) and mentions a general health impact (e.g., waterborne diseases).
Identifies several sources of water pollution and provides a basic description of their specific health impacts (e.g., gastrointestinal illness, skin irritation).

Identifies various sources of water pollution (including chemical and biological contaminants) and thoroughly explains the specific health impacts associated with each (e.g., neurological damage, reproductive issues).

Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of diverse sources of water pollution, their detailed health impacts, and provides examples of vulnerable populations. Also, provides solutions to lower water pollution impact.
Does not recognize any connection between air and water pollution or their combined effect on health.
Suggests a vague connection between air and water pollution and health.
Describes a simple relationship between air and water pollution and mentions the general impact on health.
Explains how air and water pollution can interact to exacerbate health problems or affect different populations.
Clearly articulates the interconnectedness of air and water pollution, providing specific examples of how they can combine to impact health outcomes and ecosystems.
Demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of the complex interactions between air and water pollution, their synergistic effects on health, and the broader ecological implications.
